Getting Started

Step 1

With a cloned repository, begin by compiling with the local-dev profile. This will include 4 unique agent configurations within the packaged agent jar, making standing up a 4 agent quorum easier.

cd shadowman
mvn clean install -Plocal-dev

Step 2

By default, Shadowman uses Apache Derby 10.9.1.0. Download it to a location of your choosing and expand the archive.

Step 3

Deploy shadowman customizations to your new Derby install

cp store/target/shadowman-store-<version>.jar $DERBY_HOME/lib
cp store/src/main/resources/Shadowman/* $DERBY_HOME/bin
chmod +x $DERBY_HOME/bin/ShadowmanNetworkServerControl

Step 4

Start Derby in network mode

$DERBY_HOME/bin/ShadowmanNetworkServerControl start

Step 5

Start up your agents

java -cp agent/target/shadowman-agent-1.0.0-SNAPSHOT.jar shadowman.Main purple.xml -Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote

java -cp agent/target/shadowman-agent-1.0.0-SNAPSHOT.jar shadowman.Main green.xml -Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote

java -cp agent/target/shadowman-agent-1.0.0-SNAPSHOT.jar shadowman.Main red.xml -Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote

java -cp agent/target/shadowman-agent-1.0.0-SNAPSHOT.jar shadowman.Main blue.xml -Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote

Step 6

Install the provided local-dev-resources/src/main/resources/certificates/testadmin1.p12 certificate (blank password) into a modern browser supporting svg.

Step 7

Browse to each agents monitoring console

  • Purple
  • Green
  • Blue
  • Red
